content.description: <math alttext="H A aqueous plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with A with a negative 1 charge aqueous plus H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="delta G naught equals positive 35 kilojoules per mole of reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>35</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>
content.question: Based on the chemical equation and <math alttext="delta G naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> given above, which of the following justifies the claim that <math alttext="H A aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is a weak acid?

choices.label: Because <math alttext="delta G naught is significantly greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="K sub a is significantly greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> , and <math alttext="H A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> completely dissociates.

Because <math alttext="delta G naught is significantly greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="K sub a is significantly greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="H A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> almost completely dissociates.

Because <math alttext="delta G naught is significantly greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="K sub a is significantly less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="H A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only partially dissociates.

Because <math alttext="delta G naught is significantly greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="K sub a is significantly less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="H A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> does not dissociate.

content.answer: Because <math alttext="delta G naught is significantly greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="K sub a is significantly less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="H A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only partially dissociates.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
